alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Creek; McIntosh; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Tulsa; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 02 at 8:23PM CDT until May 02 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN CREEK...NORTHERN MCINTOSH...WAGONER...CHEROKEE... OKMULGEE...MUSKOGEE...SOUTHEASTERN TULSA AND NORTHERN OKFUSKEE COUNTIES... At 822 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles north of Wagoner to near Taft to 3 miles north of Paden, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Muskogee... Tahlequah... Okmulgee... Wagoner... Bristow... Bixby... Jenks... Okfuskee... Glenpool... Coweta... Catoosa... Henryetta... Fort Gibson... Checotah... Haskell... Kiefer... Warner... Morris... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 229 and 272. Interstate 44 between mile markers 178 and 201. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Cherokee; Creek; McIntosh; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Tulsa; Wagoner
